author: SetTrend
body:
Git comes with a very nifty installer feature: The `git` installer provides a Boolean option to "only show new options" when it recognizes an existing `git` installation on a machine: ![Git Setup](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283914/108769505-5c89b580-7559-11eb-8cb7-3c54813f9379.png) I very much relish this option because I don't always have to reconsider my `git` options when I just want to install an update in a hurry.
So, I'd like to suggest to provide the same savvy option for the `PowerShell` installer.

comments.author: SetTrend
comments.body:
I noticed that when updating PowerShell Core through Windows Update, all my installation options are removed (e.g. "Add 'Open here …' PowerShell shortcut to File Explorer").

An option like the above mentioned one would help Windows Update to retain previously selected installation options.

title: Feature Request: Add option "only show new options" to PowerShell installer
